title.narrative: Promoting Research Excellence and Communication for Climate Change Adaptation
Promotion de l'excellence et de la communication dans la recherche au sujet de l'adaptation au changement climatique

description.narrative:
This project will support activities with IDRC's Climate Change program partners and grantees to package and communicate results to research users in the lead-up to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change's (UNFCCC) 21st Conference of the Parties (COP21) in December 2015.
About the Climate Change program The Climate Change program aims to support partnerships and networks to build evidence for cost-effective solutions and the smart use of technology that generate short-term social and economic gains, and guard against future climate impacts. It has three priorities: -generate new knowledge and inform policy in climate change vulnerability hotspots -increase cities' climate resilience -facilitate climate adaptation finance, particularly from private sources
Linking results to options for policy and practice The project will cover costs to -coordinate a special issue of the journal Water International on "Adaptation to the Water-Related Impacts of Climate Change in Developing Countries," which will feature peer-reviewed papers from select grantees; -support events, activities, and outputs that will share research results with targeted audiences or promote research excellence in climate change adaptation; -hire professional communications experts) to prepare research outputs and/or to profile research results; -hire external experts to support peer-review of research proposals and outputs; -translate key outputs into English, French, and Spanish; and -provide travel support for recipients' participation in conferences and other research activities.
